channel.title: NPR Topics: News
channel.description: NPR news, audio, and podcasts. Coverage of breaking stories, national and world news, politics, business, science, technology, and extended coverage of major national and world events.
channel.copyright: Copyright 2024 NPR - For Personal Use Only

item.title: Israel says it received remains of 3 hostages from Gaza as fragile ceasefire holds
item.description: Israel says the remains of three hostages have been handed over from Gaza and will be examined by forensic experts as a month-old ceasefire holds.
item.content:encoded:
Israel says the remains of three hostages have been handed over from Gaza and will be examined by forensic experts as a month-old ceasefire holds.

(Image credit: Jehad Alshrafi)
item.dc:creator: The Associated Press

item.title: In Chicago, a Halloween weekend of immigration arrests and violence
item.description: Over the weekend there were violent clashes between federal agents, witnesses and protesters. Locals say the festivities were muted this year, and fear more violence is in store for the city.
item.content:encoded:
Over the weekend there were violent clashes between federal agents, witnesses and protesters. Locals say the festivities were muted this year, and fear more violence is in store for the city.

(Image credit: Jamie Kelter Davis)
item.dc:creator: Jasmine Garsd

item.title: Kenyan runners win men's and women's races in New York City Marathon
item.description: Kipruto, an Olympic bronze medalist, narrowly beat fellow Kenyan Alexander Mutiso in the Pro Men's race, as both men finished with a time of 2:08:09.
item.content:encoded:
Kipruto, an Olympic bronze medalist, narrowly beat fellow Kenyan Alexander Mutiso in the Pro Men's race, as both men finished with a time of 2:08:09.

(Image credit: Charly Triballeau)
item.dc:creator: Chandelis Duster

item.title: How this week's elections in Virginia became about ... everything
item.description: Earlier this year, "quiet" was one word to describe the Virginia race for governor. Then came DOGE, a text message scandal down ballot, a redistricting surprise, the government shutdown and more.
item.content:encoded:
Earlier this year, "quiet" was one word to describe the Virginia race for governor. Then came DOGE, a text message scandal down ballot, a redistricting surprise, the government shutdown and more.

(Image credit: Shaban Athuman)
item.dc:creator: Jahd Khalil

item.title: Fire and explosion at northwestern Mexico store leave at least 23 dead and 12 injured
item.description: A fire and explosion at a convenience store in northwestern Mexico killed at least 23 people, including children, and injured 12 others, state authorities said.
item.content:encoded:
A fire and explosion at a convenience store in northwestern Mexico killed at least 23 people, including children, and injured 12 others, state authorities said.

(Image credit: Abraham Tellez)
item.dc:creator: The Associated Press

item.title: How U.S.-China tensions leave countries like South Korea stuck in the middle
item.description: President Trump met with President Xi on the sidelines of the Asia-Pacific Economic Cooperation summit last week. APEC's host, South Korea, is carefully balancing its relations with the U.S. and China.
item.content:encoded:
President Trump met with President Xi on the sidelines of the Asia-Pacific Economic Cooperation summit last week. APEC's host, South Korea, is carefully balancing its relations with the U.S. and China.

(Image credit: Mark Schiefelbein)
item.dc:creator: Se Eun Gong

item.title: Police rule out terrorism in stabbing attack on UK train after 2 men are arrested
item.description: Police said two people who were wounded remain in a life-threatening condition after the attack on Saturday. Passengers reported scenes of panic and chaos ,with many running through the carriages.
item.content:encoded:
Police said two people who were wounded remain in a life-threatening condition after the attack on Saturday. Passengers reported scenes of panic and chaos ,with many running through the carriages.

(Image credit: Kirsty Wigglesworth)
item.dc:creator: The Associated Press

item.title: 5 German mountaineers die in northern Italy after being hit by avalanche
item.description: Five German mountaineers died after being hit by an avalanche in South Tyrol, in northern Italy, rescuers said on Sunday.
item.content:encoded:
Five German mountaineers died after being hit by an avalanche in South Tyrol, in northern Italy, rescuers said on Sunday.

(Image credit: Corpo Nazionale Soccorso Alpino e Speleologico/AP)
item.dc:creator: The Associated Press

item.title: They were promised a lifeline to 'graduate' from poverty. Then it was taken away
item.description: Thousands of South Sudanese refugees and impoverished locals in Uganda saw a brighter future with a new USAID-funded project. They'd get $205 and coaching to build a business. Then came the cuts.
item.content:encoded:
Thousands of South Sudanese refugees and impoverished locals in Uganda saw a brighter future with a new USAID-funded project. They'd get $205 and coaching to build a business. Then came the cuts.

(Image credit: Claire Harbage/NPR)
item.dc:creator: Fatma Tanis

item.title: The time change is a chance to reset your sleep schedule â€“ especially for teens
item.description: Wondering how to help a teen get better sleep? This weekend's time change can be a boost. Here's why. Plus tips from sleep doctors to get more zzzs.
item.content:encoded: Wondering how to help a teen get better sleep? This weekend's time change can be a boost. Here's why. Plus tips from sleep doctors to get more zzzs.
item.dc:creator: Sarah Boden
